title: Ukraine Invaded Russia. Here’s What It Was Like for Civilians.

title: Living on a Volcano’s Edge, Italians Practice for Disaster

title: How Years of Government Failure Led to Nigeria’s Worst Flood in Decades
content: After a recent dam disaster, Nigerian officials blamed God, climate change and poor people. But experts had warned the dam was at risk well before it collapsed. The officials did nothing.
summary: After a recent dam disaster, Nigerian officials blamed God, climate change and poor people. But experts had warned the dam was at risk well before it collapsed. The officials did nothing.

title: Israel’s Retaliatory Attack on Iran Appears Carefully Calibrated

title: For Catholic Jubilee, Days of Joy and Sadness in Rome and Bethlehem

title: Why Are North Korean Troops in Russia?
content: Over the last month, North Korea’s role aiding Russia in its war in Ukraine has significantly escalated. U.S. officials reported that North Korean soldiers are already operating in the Kursk region in western Russia, where Ukrainian forces are staging a counteroffensive. Michael Shear, a White House correspondent for The New York Times, explains what the deeping relationship between Russia and North Korea means for the war in Ukraine and the world.
summary: Over the last month, North Korea’s role aiding Russia in its war in Ukraine has significantly escalated. U.S. officials reported that North Korean soldiers are already operating in the Kursk region in western Russia, where Ukrainian forces are staging a counteroffensive. Michael Shear, a White House correspondent for The New York Times, explains what the deeping relationship between Russia and North Korea means for the war in Ukraine and the world.
